DataElement.preferredName: Interviewer Administered Questionnaire  And Survey Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Related to interviewer administered questionnaire & participant surveys eligibility criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Interviewer Administered Questionnaire  And Survey Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Related to interviewer administered questionnaire eligibility criteria._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._A document used in a method of data collection that involves interviewing (or giving questionnaires to) a representative and often large group of people.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.

Concepts.definition: Someone who takes part in an activity.

Property.preferredName: Interviewer Administered Questionnaire And Survey Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The person who manages an interview and asks the questions.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).:A predetermined set of questions.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:A document used in a method of data collection that involves interviewing (or giving questionnaires to) a representative and often large group of people.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The person who manages an interview and asks the questions.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A document used in a method of data collection that involves interviewing (or giving questionnaires to) a representative and often large group of people.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Agrees to participate in two
ReferenceDocuments.description: Agrees to participate in two surveys (pre and post-implementation) and one confidential semi-structured telephone interview conducted by the Memorial Sloan Kettering (MSK) research associate, which will be taped, transcribed and qualitatively analyzed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: WF1805CD
ReferenceDocuments.description: Agrees to complete one brief, confidential telephone interview during completion of the Provider and Service List with the Memorial Sloan Kettering (MSK) research associate, which will be taped, transcribed, and qualitatively analyzed.
